meanings.definition: The position or office of a warden.
meanings.sent1: In the school, the wardenships were held by teachers who ensured safety.
meanings.sent2: She took on the wardenships of the park, overseeing its maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The wardenships of the zoo were so sought after that even the monkeys wanted a turn.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the wardenships of the forest was like a shield protecting the trees.
meanings.sent5: The wardenships of the castle were passed down through generations, each guardian leaving their mark.

meanings.definition: The responsibilities or duties of a warden.
meanings.sent1: The wardenships involved patrolling the borders and ensuring no intruders entered.
meanings.sent2: She managed the wardenships efficiently, never missing a beat in her duties.
meanings.sent3: The wardenships of feeding the royal pets sometimes led to comical situations.
meanings.sent4: His approach to the wardenships of the museum was meticulous, treating each artifact with care.
meanings.sent5: The wardenships of guarding the treasure were a heavy burden, but he bore it with honor.
